prompt:
Task: For each ingredient, choose the best Woolworths SKU (from candidates) and suggest how many retail packs are needed.
        Use servings + archetype context to keep quantities realistic. If no candidate fits, set selected_product_id to null and explain in package_notes.
        After mapping ingredients, optionally rewrite the cooking steps to reference the chosen products.

        Archetype snapshot:

        ```json
}
        ```

        Meal draft:
        ```json
        {
  "name": "5-Minute Chakalaka Chickpea Cheddar Wrap",
  "description": "A quick, mild South African-inspired chickpea and chakalaka wrap with melty cheddar and fresh spinach. One pan, budget-friendly, and ready fast.",
  "servings": "Single portion",
  "instructions": [
    "Heat a nonstick pan over medium heat and add olive oil.",
    "Add chickpeas and chakalaka; cook 2–3 minutes, stirring, until warmed and slightly thickened. Season with a small pinch of salt and pepper.",
    "Lay the tortilla wraps on a board. Place spinach in the center, then spoon the warm chickpea-chakalaka mix over.",
    "Top with cheddar cheese slices and fold the sides in, then roll up tightly.",
    "Return the wrap seam-side down to the pan and toast 1–2 minutes per side until lightly golden and cheese is melty.",
    "Slice in half and serve with a squeeze of lemon."
  ],
  "ingredients": [
    {
      "core_item_name": "olive oil",
      "quantity": "1 tsp"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "chickpeas",
      "quantity": "120 g (about 1/2 can)",
      "preparation": "drained and rinsed"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "chakalaka",
      "quantity": "1/3 cup"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "salt and pepper",
      "quantity": "pinch"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "tortilla wraps",
      "quantity": "1 large (25–30 cm)"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "spinach",
      "quantity": "1 cup",
      "preparation": "roughly chopped"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "cheddar cheese slices",
      "quantity": "30 g (1–2 slices)"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "lemon",
      "quantity": "1 wedge"
    }
  ],
  "meal_tags": {
    "Diet": [
      "Flexitarian"
    ],
    "Cuisine": [
      "ModernAmerican",
      "SouthAfrican"
    ],
    "PrepTime": [
      "Under15"
    ],
    "Complexity": [
      "Simple"
    ],
    "HeatSpice": [
      "Mild"
    ],
    "Allergens": [
      "Dairy",
      "Gluten"
    ],
    "BudgetLevel": [
      "ValueStaples"
    ],
    "Audience": [
      "Solo"
    ],
    "CuisineOpenness": [
      "FamiliarClassics"
    ]
  }
}
        ```

        ```json
}
        ```

    "Heat a nonstick pan over medium heat and add 1 tsp Willow Creek Lemon Flavoured Olive Oil.",
    "Add about 1/2 can Woolies Chickpeas in Brine (drained and rinsed) and 1/3 cup Woolies Mild Chakalaka; cook 2–3 minutes, stirring, until warmed and slightly thickened. Season with a pinch from the Salt and Pepper Grinder.",
    "Lay 1 White Tortilla Wrap on a board. Place a handful of Baby Spinach in the center, then spoon the warm chickpea–chakalaka mix over.",
    "Top with 1–2 slices Full Cream Cheddar Flavoured Cheese and fold the sides in, then roll up tightly.",
    "Return the wrap seam-side down to the pan and toast 1–2 minutes per side until lightly golden and the cheese is melty.",
    "Slice in half and serve with a squeeze from a wedge of lemon."
  ]
}
